headline: GM Stock Soars to Record High. Earnings Were So Good, They Helped Ford.
summary: General Motors  reported better-than-expected third-quarter earnings.  Wall Street was looking for an operating profit of $2.7 billion from revenue of $45 billion.  Management’s forecast of full-year 2025 operating profit was raised to a range of $12 billion to $13 billion from $10 billion to $12.5 billion.

raw.headline: GM Stock Soars to Record High. Earnings Were So Good, They Helped Ford.
raw.summary: General Motors  reported better-than-expected third-quarter earnings.  Wall Street was looking for an operating profit of $2.7 billion from revenue of $45 billion.  Management’s forecast of full-year 2025 operating profit was raised to a range of $12 billion to $13 billion from $10 billion to $12.5 billion.

headline: Ford Fumbles Again
summary: So far this year, Ford Motor Company has faced over 100 recalls, impacting nearly eight million vehicles – a figure equal to roughly four years of its annual production output. Many have been critical of the company’s leadership, noting that Bill Ford has remained executive chairman since 1999 despite repeated management turnovers.

raw.headline: Ford Fumbles Again

headline: General Motors gives up on BrightDrop electric vans

headline: Ford Says Aluminum Has Advantages for Trucks of the Future
summary: Ford Motor says it remains committed to aluminum, despite tight supplies after a major fire that halted production at a Novelis plant in New York for the rest of the year. The company was effectively pushing back at Lourenco Goncalves, the chief executive of Cleveland-Cliffs, who suggested on Monday that automakers were strongly considering switching aluminum designs back to steel.

headline: Syncron Secures Renewal with Major OEM
summary: STOCKHOLM, Oct. 21, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Syncron, a global leader in intelligent aftermarket Service Lifecycle Management (SLM) solutions, today announced a contract renewal with Ford Motor Company. The contract extends Syncron’s support of Ford’s retail inventory management (RIM) program, driving higher parts availability, optimized dealer inventories, and improved service through Syncron’s Dealer Parts Planning (DPP) solution. headline: Inflation Data; Intel and Tesla Earnings: What to Watch This Week
summary: The U.S. government shutdown continues, but investors won't be completely starved for economic data. Friday brings a delayed look at September’s consumer-price index, a key inflation reading that will factor into the Federal Reserve’s next decision on interest rates.

raw.headline: Inflation Data; Intel and Tesla Earnings: What to Watch This Week
